description: Believed to derive from the name of the Australian native bird rosella (genus Platycercus), a small parrot noted for its ability to vanish when the need arises.

entries.meaning: (slang, Australia) no-show, someone who does not show up as expected
examples: Every time we organise to have dinner, she never turns up.I know, she is such a rosa.

verbs.description: rosa (third-person singular simple present rosas, present participle rosaing, simple past and past participle rosaed)

examples: Weren't we meant to have dinner with Jane?No, she unfortunately had to rosa.
